quest.name: Hither and Yarns
journal: The pall of anxiety over Sharlayan Hamlet has thinned to more manageable levels.
objectives: Pick up the crate of samples.
Deliver the crate of samples to Alphinaud.
Deliver the ream of documents to the reserved representative.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Remind me to invite Urianger for a drink, when we have a moment to breathe. We're long overdue for one.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We can raise a glass to Moenbryda.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: I was so busy asking questions about Etheirys that I never thought to ask more about Urianger...

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: I'd like to, but where would I begin?

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: I assure you that my fellow Loporrits are equally excited to have this opportunity. They were humming the whole way here!

dialogue.name: SINGINGWAY
dialogue.text: We spent so long gazing at this star. Wondering, and hoping... But to be here now, to walk among the people, to be a part of their lives and know that we've made a difference... It's so much more than I ever dreamed.

dialogue.name: COOKINGWAY
dialogue.text: Goodness me, I've never felt like there was too little time before! There are so many people to talk to, so many things to learn...

dialogue.name: WILFSUNN
dialogue.text: Classical Roegadyn isn't so different from Eorzean. Did you ever wonder why we named our daughter “moon's bride”?

dialogue.name: WILFSUNN
dialogue.text: When I first held her, the moon was shining silver and full─the whole world seemed aglow. I knew it had chosen her─that she would be a beacon of that selfsame light.

dialogue.name: WILFSUNN
dialogue.text: Of course, we'd later hear our fair share of jokes about how we ought to have gone for “sun” instead, with how bright and stubborn she was. But fiery as my Moenbryda was, she was always kind. Kind and gentle.

dialogue.name: BLOEWYDA
dialogue.text: Oh... You must be one of the Scions, correct?

dialogue.name: BLOEWYDA
dialogue.text: Thank you for caring for my daughter. The time she spent with you was all too short, but I know she was proud to have you as comrades.

dialogue.name: BLOEWYDA
dialogue.text: Urianger is too, I'm sure. And I certainly feel better for knowing he has good friends to look after him. See that he comes home from time to time, will you?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ahem. Thou hast my gratitude for lending courage to the Loporrits.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Not disposed to rest on their laurels, several of our guests have elected to accompany my countrymen to their stations.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Some few may still come hither seeking counsel, and so shall I remain to aid them as need be. If thou art needed elsewhere, do not let me detain thee.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, I was hoping you might check on Alisaie. Last I saw, she was struggling to carry an enormous pile of boxes out the west gate...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I could go myself, but we both know whose help she's less like to scorn.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Not to mention that─much to my misfortune─I can think of several other things I ought to be doing. Until later!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pray assist Mistress Alisaie. She hath taken up too great a burden, like as not.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Livingway and I shall attend to matters here.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Forename! What are you doing out here?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No, I don't mind if you help with the boxes, but it's far from the most exciting of tasks. Are you sure?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, I appreciate the assistance.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We need to get these to Aporia. Time is short, of course─but they're full of organic specimens and samples, so try not to be too rough with them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud should be waiting for us when we arrive. I'll see you there!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Deliver the crate of samples to Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You will have three minutes to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can't shake the feeling that there are more of these than when I started. Did I pick up an additional crate somewhere...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Fancy seeing you here! To what do I owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alphinaud is clearly awaiting delivery of the samples...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Oh, you're helping with the crates! Wonderful─you can put that there, with the others...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You have my gratitude, but how did you come to be involved in this?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hah, then I suppose I have Thancred to thank as well.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If you're wondering why we were tasked with bringing these boxes to Aporia to begin with─so was I.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It turns out that this is a base of operations, of sorts. Those with final say as to what is included in the ship's manifest can be found here.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Father included, I suspect...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That should be everything!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You carried all of that at once!? Are you trying to injure yourself?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh, hush. They're lighter than they look─and not everyone has your delicate arms.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I suppose we should let someone know that we've finished...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Theopauldin is in the courtyard. We can report to him.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Why don't you come along? You should get credit for your assistance, at least. Considering where we are, we might even learn something interesting!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I keep thinking that I've seen him elsewhere, but I cannot for the life of me remember when.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This must be Theopauldin.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Gods, it never ends, does it? <sigh> What can I do for you?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We've brought samples from Sharlayan Hamlet─series one-one-zero? The crates are by the entrance.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Ah, thank you. I had expected one of my colleagues, but we are dreadfully shorthanded...

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Just a moment─you are Fourchenault's children, are you not?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Alphinaud and Alisaie, at your service. You're well acquainted with Father, I take it?

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Quite! I've been friends with your parents since our days at the Studium. I remember when you were yea high, waddling hither and thither...

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Clearly, it's been quite some time since we've met. 'Tis good to see you again─wielding your father's nouliths, no less!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You knew our parents when they were young? What were they like? Pray, spare no detail!

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: I should like nothing more than to regale you─alas, I am meant to be in charge here, and reams of paperwork want for submission.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We can help with that! In exchange for the sort of stories our parents would never willingly divulge, of course.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Er...very well, then. There happen to be three sets of documents in need of delivery, so how about you each take one?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Wait right there!

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: You will find a Forum representative waiting to collect these near the southernmost structure. I hope I haven't kept her waiting too long...

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Never mind Alphinaud and Alisaie─I'm certain they will be back soon enough.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Who are you, by the by? The twins' minder?

dialogue.name: LEGISLATOR04446
dialogue.text: Are you not one of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn? I thought you were meant to be working on the aetherburner...

dialogue.name: LEGISLATOR04446
dialogue.text: Theopauldin's paperwork! I was beginning to worry he had misplaced his quill.

dialogue.name: LEGISLATOR04446
dialogue.text: I appreciate your help in seeing these documents to my hands at last. As for your other task...

dialogue.name: LEGISLATOR04446
dialogue.text: Pray keep this between us, but I sincerely hope you Scions succeed.

dialogue.name: LEGISLATOR04446
dialogue.text: The exodus is, without a doubt, the most monumental undertaking in the history of the Forum, and so we must be circumspect in all respects. Risk is a privilege we cannot afford ourselves.

dialogue.name: LEGISLATOR04446
dialogue.text: At its heart, however, Sharlayan has ever been a nation of the curious. 'Twould be a tragedy indeed if we were the ones to stymie your pursuit of truth.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Quick and efficient. I daresay you have a talent for this work.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: The twins' papers only needed be delivered to elsewhere in the facility, so they should be returning any moment...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We return—with not a scrap of paperwork remaining on our persons, you will note.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: You both have my thanks─and my apologies for sending you on an errand far below your ambitions. Why, even as a babe, you struggled out of your swaddling clothes, and...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That is quite enough of that, thank you! It was compromising stories of our parents that we'd asked to hear, to reiterate.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Of course, of course. I've known your father for so long, I must have something. Hm...

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Well...as you know, part of why the Leveilleur name garners such respect in Sharlayan is your family's storied history.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: You two can trace your ancestry directly to those who came aboard Nyunkrepf's Hope─a lineage few can claim.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I've never thought much of it myself. It's not as though our forebears founded our nation. They were simply there when it happened.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, it has traditionally been a point of pride.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis why Nyunkrepf's pronouncement─“Renounce the ways of war, and pursue enlightenment through knowledge and reason”─has ever been our family's creed.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Until your grandfather's time, aye.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Archon Louisoix looked not to Nyunkrepf's words, but his deeds. He asserted, in defiance of his peers, that choosing to save the great and the small from the rising tides was the true mark of our founder's virtue.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Perhaps it was his expertise─his knowledge of ancient prophecy and the fall of civilizations─that led to him to conclude that to eschew conflict at every turn was to consign mankind to his doom...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There will ever be conflict, and calamity will follow. Thus...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: “To ignore the plight of those one might conceivably save is not wisdom─it is indolence.”

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: You remember his words well. Indeed, Archon Louisoix lived by that personal creed, and used every means at his disposal to bring succor to those in need─Sharlayan or no.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: No one loved and admired your grandfather more than his son...

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Yet Fourchenault could not reconcile Louisoix's deeds with the philosophy of their forebears and his peers─a philosophy in which he believed so fervently, yet made a pariah of his father.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Fourchenault agonized over this contradiction for much of his life.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Gods, Father...

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: A son may carry his father's blood, but his choices are his own to bear─is it not always thus?

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Gods know Fourchenault's a cranky old goat, so I'm sure you butt heads often enough. Yet even so, you must know that you are constantly in his thoughts. Every moment of every day─and that is not an exaggeration in the slightest!

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: You should have seen him when you were born─barely recognizable, he was, with a kind of dumbfounded grin I'd not seen since he first took a fancy to your mother. He was practically skipping when he told me the news.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Take my word for it─he loves you to an embarrassing degree.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: But he is also frustratingly single-minded. Once he's decided that a given action is for the best, he will stay the course no matter who or what opposes him.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: A profoundly annoying habit when you're on the other end of it, as I'm sure you will agree.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'll say!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you for your insight. When next we meet our parents, I shall mention that we spoke.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Try not to get me into too much trouble, now! I need the Forum on my side.

dialogue.name: THEOPAULDIN
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, I ought to be getting back to work. I have to make sure those specimens you brought make it to their proper places, or the cranky old goat will have my hide. We can speak again later!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Hail, you three!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: G'raha! Surely Kokkol hasn't driven you out of the forge already?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: For better or for worse, no. However, he has set me a task that requires more than my single pair of hands...and here you are!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I could use at least one of you, but I won't object to more.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, Alisaie and I have prior commitments, and we have delayed too long as it is...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What about you, Forename? Can you spare the time?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Perfect! This shouldn't take long.

obj.n: Take a Look, It's in a Book
To Care Enough to Send the Very Best
